intro: Mastichodendron foetidissimum subsp. gaumeri, commonly known as the stinking mastic tree, is a member of the family Burseraceae. It is native to the humid lowland forests of South America, particularly in Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its aromatic resinous sap, which is often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are alternate and革质 (leathery), with a distinctive scent when crushed. The subspecies gaumeri is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and habitat preferences.
